document_data.Summary: Artus Cimber, adventurer, former [[Harpers|Harper]], and member of the [[Society of Stalwart Adventurers]], discovers a [[Mulhorand|Mulhorandi]] amulet containing a powerful magical servant named [[Skuld (spirit)|Skuld]]. He and his ally, [[Hydel Pontifax]], who have spent a decade searching for the ''[[Ring of Winter]]'', hear from [[Theron Silvermace]], leader of the Stalwarts, that the ''Ring of Winter'' is in Chult, as [[Dhalmass Rayburton]], founder of the Society, saved him using magical ice, employing two of the powers of the ''Ring of Winter'': immortality and invisibility. They travel to Chult pursued by their archenemy, [[Kaverin Ebonhand]] and his ally [[Phyrra al-Quim]]. Kaverin sends his ice assassins to kill Theron and Pontifex. Artus finds the city of [[Mezro]], an ancient city home to the [[Tabaxi (tribe)|Tabaxi]] humans who follow the god [[Ubtao]]. Along the way, he meets [[Byrt]] and [[Lugg]], two speaking [[wombat]]s. He discovers that Lord Rayburton is a [[Bara]], one of seven [[paladin]]s of Ubtao that watch over Mezro with the gift of eternal life, and Rayburton denies having the ring, claiming [[Ras T'Fima]], a fellow bara, created the ice with his bara abilities. Kaverin allies with Queen [[M’bobo]] of the cannibalistic [[Batiri]] [[Goblin|goblins]], feeding Phyrra to them and replacing her with Skuld. Artus finds [[Ras Nsi]], a bara who was exiled for committing genocide on Mezro’s enemies, and learns that T’fimi is no longer a bara. He learns that the ring is in the [[Temple of Ubtao]], passes Ubtao’s test to become a bara, and claims the ring. The [[Batiri]] attack Mezro, with Kaverin seeking to gain eternal life by becoming a bara, but Artus uses the ring to kill Skuld and Kaverin and defeat the Batiri. He then begins traveling the world with [[Alisanda Rayburton]], who becomes his lover[[File:Ring of winter map.png|thumb|''The map from [[Artus Cimber]]'s journal.'']]
